result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny N Vorachack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Parenting Counseling as deemed appropriate by Agent.
Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or any other family member.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 10-16-2015.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Danny N Vorachack in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  

State moves to amend the felony the 3 misdemeanors.
Defense has no objections.
Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a Guilty to counts 1, 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 1, 2 & 3.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
3 Days Credit - If Revoked.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Parenting Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent Contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint or anyother family member.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Defendant to contact DOC by 9 am. tomorrow, 10/16/15.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of  Probation.
